message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
Map<String, String> map = new HashMap<>();
map.put("R1", "R2");
map.put("R2", "R3");
map.put("R3", "R1");
map.put("R12", "R21");
map.put("R21", "R12");

String text = "mv A, R3mv R2, Bmv R1, R3mv B, R4add A, R1add B, R1add R1, R2add R3, R3add R21, Xadd R12, Ymv X, R2";

for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : map.entrySet()) {
    text = text.replace(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code creates a HashMap with the replacements you want to make. Then it iterates over the entries in the map, replacing each occurrence of the key in the text with the corresponding value. Note that this will replace all occurrences of the keys, not just whole words. If you only want to replace whole words, you will need to use a regular expression with word boundaries, as in your Perl code.
